item.title: Appendicitis
item.description: Appendicitis # Most common surgical emergency - highest incidence between 10-20 y/os Causes/Factors # Gut organisms invade the appendix wall after lumen obstruction by lymphoid hyperplasia, faecolith or filarial worms

item.title: Cholecystitis
item.description: Cholecystitis # Inflammation of gallbladder Causes/Factors # Age Obesity Smoking low fibre intake Symptoms # Worsening of pain/symptoms after eating fatty food RUQ Pain Fever/$\uparrow$WCC Jaundice Biliary Colic $\checkmark$ X X Acute cholecystitis $\checkmark$ $\checkmark$ X Cholangitis $\checkmark$ $\checkmark$ $\checkmark$ nausea, vomiting RUQ pain - radiating round side / to back Signs # Charcot’s triad - Fever + RUQ pain + Jaundice

item.title: Hip Fractures
item.description: Hip Fractures # Fracture of the femur distal to the femoral head and proximal to a level 5 cm below the trochanter
